page.title: 12CHANGES
page.content: One of the many changes in our area since 1945 has been housing. Before then most dwellings were cottages, but now there is a mixture of cottages, bungalows, council houses and private houses. The new buildings replaced the old unsafe cottages. The population has changed too, 50 years ago it was roughly 300 now it is 375. Another thing that has increased is the attendence in Langford Parish Church. There have been changes in the landscape too, one change has been in fields being made into bigger ones by taking down hedges. Elm trees have been chopped down because of Dutch Elm disease. Another change is in the closing of schools, there used to be four schools in the area and now there is only one which is Langford Budville Primary School.
